verses.devanagari:
namo'stu nīlakaṇṭhāya sahasrākṣāya śambhave
kāraṇāya namastubhyaṁ kāraṇānāṁ ca kāraṇe
verses.iast:
namo ’stu nīlakaṇṭhāya sahasrākṣāya śambhave
kāraṇāya namas tubhyaṁ kāraṇānāṁ ca kāraṇe
verses.translation: Obeisance to the blue-throated Lord Śambhu, the thousand-eyed, the cause of all causes.

verses.devanagari:
yasya prasādāt sarvasya prasādaḥ syāt prabhoḥ sadā
yasya krodhād bhayaṁ sarvam tasmai śambhave namaḥ
verses.iast:
yasya prasādāt sarvasya prasādaḥ syāt prabhoḥ sadā
yasya krodhād bhayaṁ sarvaṁ tasmai śambhave namaḥ
verses.translation: By whose grace everyone prospers, by whose anger all are struck with fear—to that Lord Śambhu I bow.

verses.devanagari:
sarvajñaṁ sarvakartāraṁ sarvāntaryāmiṇaṁ prabhum
śaṅkaraṁ śaśiśekharaṁ vande śarvaṁ umāpatiṁ
verses.iast:
sarvajñaṁ sarva-kartāraṁ sarvāntaryāmiṇaṁ prabhum
śaṅkaraṁ śaśi-śekharaṁ vande śarvaṁ umāpatiṁ
verses.translation: I bow to Śaṅkara, the all-knowing Lord, the doer of all, the inner controller, adorned with the moon, Śarva, the consort of Umā.

verses.devanagari:
namaḥ śivāya śāntāya jagatāṁ pataye namaḥ
namo rudrāya bhadrāya bhavāya paramātmane
verses.iast:
namaḥ śivāya śāntāya jagatāṁ pataye namaḥ
namo rudrāya bhadrāya bhavāya paramātmane
verses.translation: Obeisance to Śiva, the tranquil, the Lord of the worlds; obeisance to Rudra, the auspicious, the origin of being, the Supreme Self.

verses.devanagari:
namaste śūlapāṇaye paśūnāṁ pataye namaḥ
namo nīlakaṇṭhāya vyomāntāya namo namaḥ
verses.iast:
namas te śūla-pāṇaye paśūnāṁ pataye namaḥ
namo nīlakaṇṭhāya vyomāntāya namo namaḥ
verses.translation: Salutations to the trident-wielding Lord, the master of all beings; to the blue-throated one, vast as the sky, my repeated obeisance.

verses.devanagari:
vande rudraṁ virūpākṣaṁ bhīmaṁ sarvārtha-sādhakam
mahādevaṁ mahātmānaṁ mahāpuruṣa-lakṣaṇam
verses.iast:
vande rudraṁ virūpākṣaṁ bhīmaṁ sarvārtha-sādhakam
mahādevaṁ mahātmānaṁ mahāpuruṣa-lakṣaṇam
verses.translation: I bow to Rudra, the wide-eyed, the fearsome fulfiller of all aims, Mahādeva, the great soul, bearing the marks of the Supreme Person.

verses.devanagari:
devadevaṁ jagannāthaṁ viśvarūpaṁ sanātanam
śaśāṅkamauliṁ śarvaṁ ca tryambakaṁ vṛṣabhadhvajam
verses.iast:
deva-devaṁ jagannāthaṁ viśvarūpaṁ sanātanam
śaśāṅka-mauliṁ śarvaṁ ca tryambakaṁ vṛṣabhadhvajam
verses.translation: Lord of lords, Lord of the universe, of eternal cosmic form, adorned with the moon, Śarva, three-eyed, bearing the bull-banner.

verses.devanagari:
namaḥ kālākāya bhīmāya kapardine pinākine
vyomakeśāya rudrāya namo nityāya śūline
verses.iast:
namaḥ kālākāya bhīmāya kapardine pinākine
vyomakeśāya rudrāya namo nityāya śūline
verses.translation: Obeisance to the dark-bodied, fearsome, matted-haired Lord, bearer of the bow Pināka, Rudra with sky-like hair, eternal, spear-armed.

verses.devanagari:
namas te ’stu mahābhāga mahākāya mahādyute
mahādeva mahātmānaṁ mahāpuruṣa viśruta
verses.iast:
namas te ’stu mahābhāga mahākāya mahādyute
mahādeva mahātmānaṁ mahāpuruṣa viśruta
verses.translation: Salutations to you, O greatly fortunate one, of vast body, of great radiance, Mahādeva, exalted great-souled, renowned Supreme Person.

verses.devanagari:
rudraṁ paśupatiṁ devaṁ lokānāṁ hitakārakam
śivam īśānaṁ īśānaṁ vande bhava-bhayāpaham
verses.iast:
rudraṁ paśupatiṁ devaṁ lokānāṁ hita-kārakam
śivam īśānaṁ īśānaṁ vande bhava-bhayāpaham
verses.translation: I bow to Rudra, Paśupati, the god who works for the welfare of beings, Śiva, the supreme ruler, destroyer of the fear of worldly existence.
